Kinematics#

#include "navground/core/kinematics.h"

Abstract classes#

Kinematics base class#

class Kinematics : public virtual navground::core::HasProperties, public virtual navground::core::HasRegister<Kinematics>#

Abstract Kinematics type.

A kinematics is used to

  • validated twist in the agent’s frame as feasible

  • convert between wheel speeds and body twist

  • store maximal linear and angular speed

  • store the number of degrees of freedom

Subclassed by navground::core::AheadKinematics, navground::core::OmnidirectionalKinematics, navground::core::WheeledKinematics

Public Functions

inline Frame cmd_frame() const#

The most natural frame for this kinematics: Frame::relative in case the agent is wheeled, else Frame::absolute.

Returns:

The frame

virtual Twist2 feasible(const Twist2 &twist) const = 0#

Computes the nearest feasible twist to a desired twist.

Parameters:

twist – [in] The desired twist

Returns:

The same desired twist if feasible else the nearest feasible value. How this is defined depends on the concrete sub-class.

virtual bool is_wheeled() const = 0#

Returns whether the kinematics has wheels.

Returns:

True if wheeled, False otherwise.

virtual unsigned dof() const = 0#

Returns the degrees of freedom (between 0 and 3 for planar rigid body kinematics)

Returns:

The number of degrees of freedom.

inline ng_float_t get_max_speed() const#

Gets the maximal speed.

Returns:

The maximal speed.

inline void set_max_speed(ng_float_t value)#

Sets the maximum speed.

Parameters:

value – [in] A positive value.

inline virtual ng_float_t get_max_angular_speed() const#

Gets the maximal angular speed.

Returns:

The maximal angular speed.

inline void set_max_angular_speed(ng_float_t value)#

Sets the maximum angular speed.

Parameters:

value – [in] A positive value.

Wheeled kinematics based class#

using navground::core::WheelSpeeds = std::vector<ng_float_t>#

A vector that holds wheel speeds. The order depends on the kinematics.

class WheeledKinematics : public navground::core::Kinematics#

Abstract wheeled kinematics.

Registered properties:

  • wheel_axis (float, get_axis)

Subclassed by navground::core::FourWheelsOmniDriveKinematics, navground::core::TwoWheelsDifferentialDriveKinematics

Public Functions

inline virtual bool is_wheeled() const override#

Returns whether the kinematics has wheels.

Returns:

True

virtual Twist2 twist(const WheelSpeeds &value) const = 0#

Convert wheel speeds to a twist.

Parameters:

value – [in] The wheel speeds

Returns:

The corresponding twist

virtual WheelSpeeds wheel_speeds(const Twist2 &value) const = 0#

Convert a twist to wheel speeds.

Parameters:

value – [in] The twist

Returns:

The corresponding wheel speeds.

inline ng_float_t get_axis() const#

Gets the wheel axis.

Returns:

The axis.

inline void set_axis(ng_float_t value)#

Sets the wheel axis.

Parameters:

value – [in] A positive value

Omnidirectional#

class OmnidirectionalKinematics : public navground::core::Kinematics#

Unconstrained kinematics (e.g., quad-copters)

Public Functions

inline OmnidirectionalKinematics(ng_float_t max_speed = 0, ng_float_t max_angular_speed = 0)#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – [in] The maximal speed

  • max_angular_speed – [in] The maximal angular speed

inline virtual bool is_wheeled() const override#

Returns whether the kinematics has wheels.

Returns:

False

inline virtual unsigned dof() const override#

Returns the degrees of freedom.

Returns:

3

Ahead#

class AheadKinematics : public navground::core::Kinematics#

Kinematics for non-wheeled agents that head towards where they move (e.g., people)

Public Functions

inline AheadKinematics(ng_float_t max_speed = 0, ng_float_t max_angular_speed = 0)#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – [in] The maximal speed

  • max_angular_speed – [in] The maximal angular speed

inline virtual bool is_wheeled() const override#

Returns whether the kinematics has wheels.

Returns:

False

inline virtual unsigned dof() const override#

Returns the degrees of freedom.

Returns:

2

Two wheels differential drive#

class TwoWheelsDifferentialDriveKinematics : public navground::core::WheeledKinematics#

Two differential drive wheels (left, right) (e.g., a wheelchair)

Public Functions

inline TwoWheelsDifferentialDriveKinematics(ng_float_t max_speed = 0, ng_float_t axis = 0)#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – [in] The maximal wheel speed

  • axis – [in] The wheel axis (i.e., the distance between the wheels)

inline virtual unsigned dof() const override#

Returns the degrees of freedom.

Returns:

2

virtual Twist2 twist(const WheelSpeeds &speeds) const override#

See WheeledKinematics::twist.

Parameters:

speeds – [in] The wheel speeds in the order {left, right}

Returns:

The corresponding twist

virtual WheelSpeeds wheel_speeds(const Twist2 &twist) const override#

See WheeledKinematics::wheel_speeds.

Parameters:

twist – [in] The twist

Returns:

The corresponding wheel speeds in the order {left, right}

Four wheels omnidirectional drive#

class FourWheelsOmniDriveKinematics : public navground::core::WheeledKinematics#

Four Omni-differential wheels (e.g., a Robomaster)

Warning

We assume that the distance between front and back wheel centers is the same as the lateral distance.

Public Functions

inline FourWheelsOmniDriveKinematics(ng_float_t max_speed = 0, ng_float_t axis = 0)#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – [in] The maximal wheel speed

  • axis – [in] The wheel axis (i.e., the distance between the wheels)

inline virtual unsigned dof() const override#

Returns the degrees of freedom.

Returns:

3

virtual Twist2 twist(const WheelSpeeds &speeds) const override#

See WheeledKinematics::twist.

Parameters:

speeds – [in] The wheel speeds in the order {front left, rear left, rear right, rear left}

Returns:

The corresponding twist

virtual WheelSpeeds wheel_speeds(const Twist2 &twist) const override#

See WheeledKinematics::wheel_speeds.

Parameters:

twist – [in] The twist

Returns:

The corresponding wheel speeds in the order {front left, rear left, rear right, rear left}
